dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time is 1959. HOLLY SARGIS, the 15-year-old heroine, her bed, petting her dog. The CAMERA DOLLIES BACK as she

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OVER.
dialogues.text: HOLLY (v.o.) My mother died of pneumonia when I was just a kid. My fat kept their wedding cake in the freezer for ten whole year the funeral he gave it to the yardman... He tried to act  cheerful, but he could never be consoled by the little st he found in his house. Then, one day, hoping to begin a n away from the scene of all his memories, he moved us from to Ft. Dupree, South Dakota. HOLD on FULL SHOT of bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets and alleys of Ft. Dupree at dawn. On sound we the clucking of DOVES. A garbage truck appears. Details o mechanisms at the back of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIT CARRUTHERS, the hero, a 25-year-old garbageman, kneel a dead dog. He inspects it briefly. then looks back at hi and co-worker, CATO, a stocky man in his forties.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I'll give you a dollar to eat this collie. Cato inspects the dog.

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: I'm not going to eat him for a dollar... I don't think he collie, either. Some kind of dog. They drive off.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Watch your heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck comes to a stop. Kit bangs on the driver's door

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey. Woody. Gimme a cigarette. WOODY waves him off. Kit shrugs to Cato.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Woody wouldn't give me a cigarette. (pause) Ever notice h talk much? Cato agrees with this. They make a terrible racket, with regard for the sleep of the neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly, whispering some rhyme to herself, twirls a baton i middle of an empty street.  HOLLY (v.o.) Little did I realize that what began in the alleys and ba of this quiet town would end in the Badlands of Montana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit tries to sell a passing BUM a pair of shoes.

dialogues.speaker: BUM
dialogues.text: Nah. they wouldn't fit.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: How do you know? You hadn't tried them on yet.

dialogues.speaker: BUM
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Gimme a dollar for them... Cost twenty new. The Bum walks off. Kit pitches the shoes to Cato.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Why don't you see if they fit you? Cato picks them up and looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: TRASH CAN
dialogues.text: Kit is culling through a trash can, looking for valuables reading other people's mail, etc.  KIT (o.c.) This lady don't ever pay her bills. She's gonna get in tr she doesn't watch out. Cato, ignoring him, picks up a magazine that is lying in grass. When the CAMERA returns to Kit, he has stripped of apron.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I throwed enough trash for today, Cato.... I'll see you I morning. He slaps Cato on the back and walks off. Cato throws a mo loaf of bread at his back.

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Catch!

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What do you mean? He throws the loaf back at Cato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit walks through the deserted alleys of the sleeping tow the MAIN TITLES APPEAR. He balances a stolen mop on his f he stomps a can and looks around to see if anyone has spo at this. As the CREDITS end he sees Holly in front of her twirling her baton. He crosses the street and introduces

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Kit. I'm not keeping you from anything important,

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, I was just messing around over there, thought I'd c and say hello to you. (smiling) I'll try anything once. ( What's your name? I said mine.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Holly.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Listen, Holly. you want to take a walk with me?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well. I got some stuff to say. Guess I'm kind of lucky th Most people don't have anything on their minds, do they? Holly eyes him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the middle of the street. Holly has accept offer.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Oh, incidentally, my last name is Carruthers. Sounds a li much like В“druthers,В” doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, nobody asked me what I thought. They just hung it o Holly breaks the silence that follows.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You still in school?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Nah, I got me a job. HOLLY (o.c.) Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, I don't mind getting up early, so I got a job throw garbage... I'm not in love with the stuff, okay. In the distance we hear Holly's FATHER calling her. She e off.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: That's my father. I got to run.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey. wait a minute. When am I going to see you again? Holly isn't sure how to reply.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, I know what my daddy's going to say. KIT (o.c.) What?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Can I be honest?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, that I shouldn't be seen with anybody that collects garbage. KIT (o.c.) He'll say that?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah. KIT (o.c.) Now what's he know about garbage, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Nothing. KIT (o.c.) There you go.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, I mean there's nothing he wants to know about it... got to run. She waves goodbye and runs off. Kit waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly walks into the back yard, where her father is worki Half-painted signs lean against the garage.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Just some boy. He throws some paint off his brush onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Is that going to kill the grass? He flicks his brush teasingly at her feet. She retreats t chair, giggling.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You got some on my feet.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: What'd he want?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Just wanted to know if we needed any yardwork done... I s and for him not to bother us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit is talking with a CLERK inside an employment agency.  CLERK (o.c.) You ever held another job before?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I used to throw trash for the City.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: You lost that one?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Wouldn't be here if I hadn't.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: What kind of work do you think you would be qualified for

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I can't think of anything at the moment... I'd like you t me out a slip, though, proving I came down here. The Clerk leafs through his papers.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Well, I think we could find you something... working catt at the pens. Kit sighs.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well. what the hell. Just hope there's a breeze. The Clerk gives him a slip of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly sees Kit approaching the house.  HOLLY (v.o.) He was handsomer than anybody I'd ever met. He looked jus James Dean. She walks out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, stop the world.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Quit my job.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Just seemed like the right move... Whatcha doing?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Spanish. KIT (o.c.) How do you say "Quit my Job" in Spanish?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Something mi trabajo. Kit offers her a cigarette, which she declines.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm going to work as a cowboy now... Or think about it. It's a routine, like anything. What do you thin

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I don't know. He pulls himself up onto the bannister beside her.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, at least nobody could get on me about wearing these any more. She watches him intently. This makes him uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You want to go for a ride?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, I got homework. KIT (o.c.) Bring it along. His forwardness surprises her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are walking through the downtown area. Kit kicks a p that someone has discarded on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Somebody dropped a bag on the sidewalk. She appears nervous about being seen alone with him.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Everybody did that, the whole town'd be a mess ... Hi. He greets a passing stranger.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You're a redhead.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Anybody ever call you "Red"?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Just don't... I've got a headache.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah? He steers her toward his car, a customized Mercury. As sh in, he asks her KIT (o.c.) Can I come around and see you tomorrow? HOLLY (startled) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Kit at work at the feedlot. throwing hay to the ca feeding them pills, etc.  HOLLY (v.o.) Kit went to work in the feedlot while I carried on with m studies. Little by little we fell in love... As I'd never popular in school and didn't have a lot of personality, I surprised that he took such a liking to me, especially wh could've had any other girl in town if he'd given it half The MONTAGE includes a shot of Holly running toward Kit's some rendezvous.  HOLLY (v.o.) He said that I was grand, though, that he wasn't interest for sex and that coming from him this was a compliment. H never met a fifteen-year-old girl who behaved more like a and wasn't giggly. He didn't care what anybody else thoug looked good to him, and whatever I did was okay, and if I have a lot to say, well, that was okay, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly are sitting under a tree. playing cards on blanket. Holly surveys the area.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What a nice place. KIT (absorbed in game) Yeah, the tree makes it nice.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: And the flowers... Let's not pick them. They're so nice.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: It's your play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly's father paints a picture. using a stereopticon to with his backgrounds. TRACK with Kit driving down a stree Mercury. Holly sits watching football practice.  HOLLY (v.o.) Of course I had to keep all this a secret from my dad. He would've had a fit, since Kit was ten years older than me came from the wrong side of the tracks, so called. Our ti each other was limited and each lived for the precious ho he or she could be with the other away from all the cares world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly are necking underneath some bleachers. In t distance we hear the NOISE of the football practice.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: My stomach's growling.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: There's an old Fudgesicle over there. You want it?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: No. Kit laughs, and starts her laughing, too.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Somebody else is going to get it.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Kids eat that kind of stuff in Korea. At this her expression turns serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit in CLOSEUP at a fence in the feedlot, an intense look face.  VARIOUS ANGLES of the cattle in their pens. They look num morose.  TIGHT SHOT of Holly necking with Kit.  HOLLY (v.o.) In the stench and slime of the feedlot, he'd remember how looked the night before, how I ran my hand through his ha traced the outline of his lips with my fingertip. He want die with me, and I dreamed of being lost forever in his a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT of Holly's pet catfish in a bowl.  CUT TO WIDE SHOT of Holly with gloves on carrying the fis through the garden in back of her house. She looks around then throws it out among the melons.  HOLLY (v.o.) The whole time, the only thing I did wrong was throwing o fish when he got sick. Later I got a new one, but this in kept on bothering me and I turned to Kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly walk down a sidewalk in the residential par town. Kit is consoling her about the fish.  HOLLY (v.o.) I didn't mind telling Kit about stuff like this, cause st things happened in his life, too, and some of the stuff h was strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit steps on top of a dead cow, as though to convince him that it is dead.  HOLLY (v.o.) For instance,. he faked his signature whenever he used it keep other people from forging important papers with his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA DOLLIES BACK to reveal Kit lying in bed. His a suggests that this is a scene of her fantasy.  HOLLY (v.o.) And as he lay in bed, in the middle of the night, he alwa a noise like somebody was holding a seashell against his sometimes he'd see me coming toward him in beautiful whit and I'd put my cold hand on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit puts on his jacket and heads down a riverbank to the the water. Holly comes into view, buttoning her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Did it go the way it 'uz supposed to?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Is that all there is to it?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Her questions make him uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Gosh, what was everybody talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Don't ask me. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well. I'm glad it's over... For a while I was afraid I mi before it happened... Had a wreck, some deal like that. Kit points to an uprooted tree lying in the water a hundr away.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You see where that tree fell in the water? He climbs back up the bank.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah... The river must've washed the roots away... You do about anything I say, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly walks down the bank of the river. Kit falls in behi carrying a large stone. The CAMERA DOLLIES with them.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You know what I think?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: That we should crunch our hands with this stone. That way never forget what happened today.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: But it would hurt.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, that's the point, stupid. She gives him a cold look.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Don't call me stupid.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Okay, but I'm going to keep it for a souvenir... He throws it awav and picks up a smaller one.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Or maybe one that's lighter. He walks over to the car. A bridge is visible in the dist

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit releases a large red balloon into the evening sky. A basket is fixed to the bottom of the balloon.  HOLLY (v.o.) Kit made a solemn vow that he would always stand beside m let nothing come between us. He wrote this out in writing the paper in a box with some of our little tokens and thi then sent it off in a balloon he'd found while on the gar route. (pause) His heart was filled with longing as he wa drift off. Something must've told him that we'd never liv days of happiness again, that they were gone forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly's dog bounds through a stand of cattails. Holly spe angrily to her father, who walks toward the dog with a gu not hear their voices, only music. He shoots the dog and runs off in horror.  HOLLY (v.o.) Then, sure enough, Dad found out I'd been running around his back. He was madder than I'd ever seen him. As punish deceiving him, he went and shot my dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly's father drags a duffel bag out of his truck and du over the side of a bridge, into a river. It goes under br then bobs to the surface. The current takes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly sits in the second-story window of a music school.  HOLLY (v.o.) He made me take extra music lessons every day after schoo wait there till he came to pick me up. He said that if th didn't keep me off the streets. maybe the clarinet would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit approaches Holly's father, who is hard at work, paint billboard along a deserted stretch of road. Kit is eating peach.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Sure is pretty.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: What'd you come out here for?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I wasn't aware there was any law against it. Kit sees that this kind of talk will not do. He is silent moment, then throws the peach away.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You know Holly... well. she means a lot to me, sir. Holly's father goes solemnly about his business.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You know, before I met her, nobody could ask me how I was with my girl. Matter of fact, I didn't really have one.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kit walks off a few paces and leans against the father's

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: It okay me leaning on your Willys here? Holly's father does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Listen. I got a lot of respect for her, sir. (pause) That as good a one as I know to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Well, it's not good enough. (pause) Just what do you thin happen to her if she stuck around with you, Kit? Guy like

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: She'd get along okay. And if she didn't, well, she could off, just take off, (and) I wouldn't mind... I'd always t people I deserved it. Holly's father comes to his feet and fixes Kit in the eye

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: You get out of here. I don't want you hanging around any You understand? He lets these words sink in, then returns to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) You're something. Kit waves goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Takes all kinds, sir. He walks to his car, looking back once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT of father at work at billboard. Kit approaches house, collects the evening newspaper from the sidewalk, knocks on the front door. Holly's father picks her up fro outside the music school. Kit, when he gets no answer, en house. The jeep, with Holly and her father, rumbles down residential street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit is going through Holly's dresser, throwing her things suitcase. A pistol is visible in his back pocket. Suddenl Holly's father appears in the dresser mirror, standing at of the hall outside the bedroom.  Kit walks forward to greet him. The CAMERA DOLLIES with h

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I've got a gun here, sir. It's always a good idea to have around. Kit draws the pistol. He is shaken, though he must have s coming.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing? Go on, get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, I got it all planned... and I'm taking Holly off wi He looks at Holly, who has appeared on the landing, uncer what her reaction to all this will be.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Okay, boy, I'm turning you over to the authorities. Kit steps forward as Holly's father starts down the stair

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: For coming onto my property... With a gun.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: No, you're not either. FATHER (o.c.) Yeah? Why not?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Cause I can't allow it. Holly's father stares at him for a moment, then continues the stairs. Kit starts forward.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey... Hey, wait a minute. His shout arrests Holly's father at the bottom of the sta

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Suppose I shot you. How'd that be? Huh? Holly's father does not move.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You want to hear what it sounds like? He fires a shot into the stairs. The report is deafening enclosure of the stairwell. They exchange looks. Kit's br is heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly's father turns and walks into the living room. Kit down the stairs. Holly shouts his name.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey, where you going? He fires two shots into Holly's father, who slowly sinks floor. Kit unlimbers his shoulder. Holly rushes down the to her father's side.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Daddy... This is Holly... Are you going to be okay? Her father does not respond. She looks back at Kit, who a her gaze. She gets to her feet and walks nto the kitchen. follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit closes the back door to the house.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I came in the front.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: How bad off is he? KIT (o.c.) I can look and see.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: We better call the doctor... Listen. I'll say how it happ part I saw. KIT (sighs) Well... I don't think that'd work. This startles Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit touches the father's heart.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: He don't need a doctor. He walks back into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You don't believe me, see for yourself. Holly stares at her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE of Holly's house silhouetted against the evenin On sound the NOISE of CICADAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit drags Holly's father into the cellar. sets him down g then eases out of the room, taking a discarded toaster wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit comes up the steps from the cellar. Holly stands at t drainboard.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I found a toaster. He sets down the toaster and walks over to Holly's side.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Listen, honey. I don't want to... She slaps him across the forehead. He walks into the now living room, and sits down at the piano. After a moment H follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly sits down on the sofa across from Kit.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Listen, maybe we ought to tell somebody about this.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You said that once already... Too late now.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: They're not going to listen to me. You either. Are you ki A silence follows.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Suppose the neighbors heard the noise?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Wouldn't be funny... Listen, I'll be back in a while. He gets up and heads for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Oh... You want to call the police, that's fine. Just won' hot for me. There are tears in Holly's eyes now. They exchange looks opens the front door. Then he leaves. Holly settles back couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house by night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly comes up the stairs, smoking a cigarette. She walks bedroom window. The CAMERA DOLLIES with her. Outside, und street lamp, she can see two boys trading secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit puts fifty cents into a gramophone booth. He clears h as the machine whirs Into operation.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: My girl Holly and I have decided to kill ourselves, same did her dad. Big decision huh? Well, the reasons are obvi I don't have time to go into them right now... One thing, though... He was provoking me when I popped him. That's w was like, a POP. Inserts of the booth's mechanism a light panel measuring off the seconds and the needle on record.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Course nobody's coming out of this thing happy, especiall us. You can't deny we've had fun, though. Which is more t can say for some.... Mmmm. that's the end of the message. out of things to say... Thank you. He gets these last words in just as his time is up. He ge record and steps outside the booth, into the lobby of a t station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit slams a ten-gallon can of gasoline down on the piano opens it and begins pouring it out over the interior of t house, kicking aside everything that comes in his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly comes out the screen door at the back of the house, carrying a suitcase and a painting. Kit appears with a la extension cord. He sets it down beside a victrola he has on a table outdoors. He puts the needle on the record he earlier. Holly watches him as she retreats to the car.  HOLLY (v.o.) Kit left a record playing over and over for the District to find. He was gambling for time. Kit unplugs the lamp, lights a book of matches and pitche into a puddle of gas. The back porch of the house explode flame. Kit runs to the car with the lamp, caught off guar force of the flames. They drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various objects around the house burst into flames a picture we saw on the stairs. some peacock feathers, a  cantaloupe and a pomegranate left on the kitchen table, t living room, Holly's bedroom, the bed itself, a doll on t an A&W Root Beer sign outside the house, a water can, swirling out the front of the house. Holly's father in CL the cellar, sheet music lifting off the piano. etc. At le CAMERA PANS over the charred frame of Holly's bed. Outsid fireman moves with a flashlight through the embers of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly collects her books from a locker at her school and anxiously down a corridor towards the exit.  HOLLY (v.o.) Kit made me get my books from school, so I wouldn't fall We'd be starting a new life, he said. and we'd have to ch names. His would be James. Mine would be Priscilla. We'd like spies, somewhere in the North, where people didn't a of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly breaks into a run as she comes through the front do the high school. Kit waits for her at the car. There is n else in sight.  HOLLY (v.o.) I could of snuck out the back or hid in the boiler room, suppose, but I sensed that my destiny now lay with Kit, f better or for worse, and that it was better to spend a we one who loved me for what I was than years of loneliness. She gets into the car and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit studies Holly for signs of her mood.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: How you doing? HOLLY (neutrally) I'm fine. Kind of tired.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. The car sails down a quiet street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA DOLLIES with a tree floating down a swollen ri Cottonwood trees cover the far bank.  HOLLY (v.o.) We hid out In the wilderness,down by a river in a grove o cottonwoods. It being the flood season we built our house trees, with tamarisk walls and willows laid side by side a floor. There wasn't a plant in the forest that didn't c handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Details of the cottonwoods, willow and tamarisk. Music co under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Details of Kit and Holly building the treehouse. Kit poun into place wi h a tomahawk; Holly scrapes the bark off a a piece of flint; Kit weaves tamarisk branches through th of the house. This MONTAGE ends with a PAN DOWN the four of the completed treehouse.  HOLLY (v.o.) We planned a huge network of tunnels under the forest flo our first order of business every morning was to decide o password for the day. ow and then weld sneak out at night steal a chicken or a bunch of corn or some melons from a patch... Mostly. though, we just lay on our backs and sta the clouds and sometimes it was like being in a big marbl the way we talked in low voices and heard the tiniest sou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS off Holly's painting, a Maxwell Parrish, asleep with his pistol beside him. then onto Holly under with a box of shells beside her. Her hand quivers once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit lifts an egg out of a bird's nest at the top of a tre drops it down to Holly, fifty feet below.  HOLLY (v.o.) They hadn't found but one set of bones in the ashes of th so we knew they'd be looking for us. Kit made sure we'd b prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit cuts a piece of twine that lies across a trail, where ball full of spikes comes swinging down out of the trees. lethal force. Kit ducks out of the way. We next see Kit w dew ag around his forehead, running laps through the wood part of his training. He exhorts himself to greater effor HOLLY (v.o.) He gave me lectures on how a gun works, how to take it ap put it back together again. in case 1 had to carry on wit him. He said that if the Devil came at me, I could shoot a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly struggles through the undergrowth witha yoke over h shoulders, carrying wood back to the teahouse.  HOLLY (v.o.) One day, I carried thirty pounds of wood a distance of fi miles. Another day, while hiding in the forest, I covered with makeup, to see how they'd come out.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON HOLLY'S EYES
dialogues.text: Holly has made her eyes up with mascara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly dance the stroll to the sound of Mickey and on their Zenith portable. Holly shows a better sense of r than Kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit lifts a fish out of the river with a crude device lik lacrosse net. Holly sits on the bank In the b.g. The fish wriggles out of the net and falls back In the water. Kit  struggles in vain to retrieve it.  HOLLY (v.o.) We had our bad moments, like any couple. Kit accused me o being along for the ride,while at times I wished he'd fal river and drown, so I could watch. Kit throws his net down in disgust, partly at Holly.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Take a break. Red... Life of Riley, huh? Holly ignores him as he walks off down the flat.  HOLLY (v.o.) Mostly. though. we got along fine and stayed in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly, in curlers, walks over to where Kit is shaving.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: One of the chickens died last night. She pats a little water on her face, dries it with a burl towel, picks up a hatchet and walks off into the forest t the morning's firewood.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I almost stepped on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly sits on the upper deck of the treehouse, reading Ko aloud to Kit.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: "The Kon-Tiki in motion was a little different from what usually was in such conditions. We had become sensitive t changes in the rhythm of the logs. I thought at once of s from the coast, which was drawing near, and was continual on the deck and up the mast..."

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: He was nervous. Holly looks at him for a moment, trying to understand the of this interruption, then resumes

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: "Time passed. At dawn, just before six, Torstein came hur down from the masthead. He could see a whole line of smal clad islands far ahead..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly walks down the edge of the river, fresh from her ba wrapped in a white sheet. The river is raging, with white visible in places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange animal, not a deer or a horse, but like them, m languidly through the thick of the forest. Holly puts dow binoculars, amazed.  HOLLY (v.o.) I grew to love the forest. The cooing of the doves and th dragonflies in the air made it always seem lonesome and l everybody's dead and gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit sits in the crow's nest at the top of the treehouse, through a copy of National Geographic. amused by what he looking around to find somebody he can share it with.  HOLLY (v.o.) When the leaves rustled overhead, it was like the spirits whispering about all the little things that bothered 'em.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON SLIDES
dialogues.text: An array of stereo slides is spread out on the leaves of forest floor. Holly puts one in her stereopticon and stud Kit greets her as he walks by with a log over his shoulde HOLLY (v.o.) One day, while taking a look at some vistas in Dad's  stereopticon, it hit me that I was just this little girl, Texas, whose father was a sign painter and who had only j many years to live ...

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON SLIDES
dialogues.text: With each of her thoughts a slide appears a canal in Brazil, a camel boy in front of the Great Pyra some cows standing in a fjord with a steamship in the dis mother with her child, a woman playing the piano as anoth looks on, a family on a lawn, a soldier in a wheatfield  whispering something into his girlfriend's ear.  HOLLY (v.o.)... It sent a chill down my spine, and I thou Where would I be this very moment if Kit had never met me killed anybody? This very moment... If my Mom had never m Dad? If she'd of never died?... And what's the man I'll m going to look like? What's he doing right this minute? .. thinking about me now, by some coincidence, even though h doesn't know me? Does it show on his face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit is fishing with his crude net. He stops briefly to wa truck passing down the highway In the distance, then goes work. This stretch of river seems dangerously close to  civilization.  HOLLY (v.o.) For days afterward I lived in dread. At times I wished I fall asleep and be taken off to some magical land, but th happened. Kit, frustrated draws his pistol from his back pocket and around for the fish that has been eluding him. He does no as we do, a MAN watching him from across the river. He fi the fish. misses it and fires again. The Man across the r hesitates. then moves back into the undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly is off somewhere in the forest. putting on lipstick sits on watch in the crowls nest, a pair of binoculars cl hand. On sound, over the music, we hear voices whispering them. Kit sees a movement in the brush. A moment later a appears, a hunter, carrying a gun. Kit shouts a code word Holly. She takes off running, as Kit clambers down the pl the treehouse and collects his shotgun. He tells her to h runs through the woods and dives in a hole, under a cover leaves. She jumps behind a log. Several shots of the stil follow, then the hunters appear, a shoulder here. pant le The music ends as one of them cocks his gun. They pass ri the hole where Kit is hiding. Kit rises up slowly, gives gentlemanly word of warning, then shoots all three in the He checks to see if anybody else is with them, then calls out to Holly.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Holly! Holly picks her way through the brush, back to the treeho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are packed up and ready to leave. Kit slams the trun Mercury.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Get in the car, Red. He takes a bird cage off the roof of the car and throws i

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: We don't need this. He climbs a ladder, looks In the cabin of the treehouse t they've left anything behind, then jumps down. He flips o wicker hemisphere that covers their rooster. The rooster off, free. He surveys the woods, then looks back at Holly returns his look and gets in the car.  HOLLY (v.o.)Kit felt bad about shooting those men in the but he said they'd come in like that. and they would've p as down and dirty as they could, and besides, held overhe whispering about how they were only interested in the rew money. With lawmen it wouldtve been different. They were there to get a job done and they deserved a fair chance. a bounty hunter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a flat expanse of the Badlands. The Mercury appear the horizon and heads toward a solitary house. A man appe the door of the house, Kit's friend, Cato.  HOLLY (v.o.) We went to hide out with a friend of Kit's from the days garbage route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit gets out of the car, takes a chicken from the back se walks over to face Cato. He keeps a safe distance.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: How you doing, Cato?

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Not bad. Kit steps forward, rifle in hand, and offers Cato the chi

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Take that sombitch. Cato takes it, a wan smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What you been doing?

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Running this place for a fella in town. Nothing much to s

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, I don't notice us hustling trash, either. Kit walks over to inspect the interior of Cato's house.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Where'd you get them antlers? CATO (o.c.) They come with the house. He refers to a set of deer antlers, mounted over the door looks inside, then back at Cato.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Oh, Cato, I want you to meet my girl, Holly Sargis. Holly smiles and says hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit at a picnic table under a tree, having lunch. Ho telling a joke at Kit's urging.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Did you hear the one about the guy in the nuthouse that w around naked, with only a hat and gloves on, and this nur up to him and said, "Hey, what... You can't walk around t way," and the guy says, "What's the matter? Nobody comes here." Anyway, the nurse says, "What do you have the hat gloves on for, then?" And the guy says, "Well, you never Cato bursts into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Isn't that funny? Cato stops laughing. He wants to give Kit the right answe

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess. KIT (o.c.) She plays the clarinet, too. Holly smiles politely.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Don't you ever get bored around here?

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Sometimes. The other day, though, an old boy was plowing field over there, found some old Spanish coins.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (suspicious) That's what he told you, huh? CATO (o.c.) No, he showed me one.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What'd they look like? CATO (o.c.) Kind of round, like so... Gold. I'll show you if you want Kit and Holly eye one another. Kit sees the chance to mak fortune here. He is careful to conceal his feelings, thou

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Let me finish my supper. Holly, big-eyed, bites into an apple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit, Holly and Cato walk out to the field where Cato hear coins were found. Holly picks up a pot lid.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: We're thinking of going down to Texas. Holly wants to vis of her people down there, but after that I don't know... Mexico's nice. Cato stops.

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Kit... Maybe I'd better get a shovel.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: I'll catch up with you.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Okay. Kit walks out into the field to join Holly. Cato turns ba

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I found a lid. It was laying on the ground over there.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Put that down. It's dirty. Holly tosses the lid at him. He picks up some dirt clods starts throwing them at her. She squeals and dodges. CATO them for a while, indecisive, then turns and runs.  HOLLY (o.c.) Hey, you're throwing big ones! Suddenly, Kit spots Cato.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Cato! Cato jumps over a trough and comes to a stop in front of truck, a water tanker.

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: The shovel's in the truck. Kit raises his gun and shoots Cato through the belly. CAT then gets to his feet and stumbles toward the front door house. Kit follows him for a while, then skips forward an the door for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cato falls on his bed and rolls over to face Kit. Kit wal calmly and picks up a photo on the bureau.  HOLLY (v.o.) Kit never let on why he'd shot Cato. He said that just ta about it could bring us bad luck and that right now we ne the luck we could get. Kit sets the photo down.  KIT (o.c.) You never told me about her. He looks under the bed, then walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly stands near a window. smoking a cigarette. Kit sets rifle down and surveys the room, which is cluttered with ends.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Look at all this junk.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (shrugging) I got him in the stomach. Holly sits down.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Is he upset?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: He didn't say anything to me about it. He takes a drag off her cigarette and gives it back to he leafs idly through a catalogue on the table, then walks o look in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Bunch of junk. Inside the bedroom Cato is still conscious, but his breat heavy. Kit walks back to Holly's side. HOLLY is looking t the catalogue.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: He stole that cage. I saw him doing it. Kit wants this to have been an execution, not a murder.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Whatcha looking in there for? We can't afford any of that HOLLY (defensive) Just looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they bicker in the other room, Cato inspects his face mirror.  KIT (o.c.) Why don't you go in there and keep him company for a whil Holly walks in the door.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Hi. She sits down.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: That your spider in there? in that bottle?

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What do you feed him?

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Oh, flies... grasshoppers when I can catch 'em.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Does he bite?

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: He never bit me. We hear the sound of a car HORN in the distance. HOLLY turns and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 1951 Studebaker approaches the house. There are two peo inside, a BOY and a GIRL. Kit comes out the front door. T and Girl get out, but seeing Kit, they wait by the car.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Hi. where's Cato?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Gone? ... Where?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: He said not to tell. BOY (o.c.) Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah, he said for you to give us a lift into town. You're ones with the Studebaker, aren't you? The Boy hesitates a second, then starts for the house.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Well, I just need to pick up something in the house. Kit draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: No... You go in there, I'll have to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Can't afford to take chances. The Girl is baffled.  KIT (o.c.) Come on out of there, young lady. Kit waves them out into the neighboring field with him.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Let's us step out in this field here. The Boy raises his hands.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Nah, skip that... I'm going to have to keep an eye on you though.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You don't mind? Holly steps out the front door and smiles at the girl.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly and the girl walk through the field toward a storm where the boys are waiting for them. The wind is blowing

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to Jack and me?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You have to ask Kit. He says frog, I jump.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What's your friend's name?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Jack.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You love him?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I don't know. Holly thinks about this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I've got to stick by Kit... He feels trapped.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah. I can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, I've felt that way, hadn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit guides the couple into the storm cellar.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Okay, you two, down in the cellar. They head down the steps into the cellar, the Girl first. stops the Boy for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You promise to stay down there for an hour?

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You expect me to believe that? He looks back at Holly, as though to ask whether he shoul

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Kit nods and waves the Boy down into the cellar. The Boy  disappears. Kit shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I'm going to shut the door. Kit sticks a pin through the latch, hesitates, then fires shots down through a seam into the cellar. He retreats to side. a little surprised at what he did.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Think I got 'em?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not going down there and look. He starts running away from the cellar. Holly follows him storm is gathering on the horizon. Kit offers Holly his h they run. but Holly does not see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cato lies motionless, on his bed. Holly steps forward and him with a yardstick, like a child touching a snake.  HOLLY (v.o.) Suddenly, I was thrown into a state of shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit, rifle in hand, lumbers out a side door of the house Cato over his shoulder. He steers for a nearby box car th evidently served Cato as a shed.  HOLLY (v.o.) Kit was the most trigger happy person I'd ever met. He cl that as long as you're playing for keeps and the law is c you, it's considered okay to shoot all witnesses. You had the consequences, though, and not whine about it later. Kit opens the doors of the box car. and dumps Cato inside closing the doors he checks Cato's shoes. to see if they ones he gave him. Holly looks on from the side of the hou twenty yards away.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: We're in for it now... If they catch us. Kit looks cornered and defensive. Holly thinks for a mome

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What'd you put him in there for? KIT (shrugging) Just to keep him out of the sun. Kit heads out of sight around the rear of the box car. Ho back inside. Kit walks up and down the length of the box talking under his breath and throwing his rifle from hand hand, in a state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly travel down a country road in the Studebake HOLLY (v.o.) At this moment I didn't feel shame or fear, but just kind blah, like when you're sitting there and all the water's of the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit, driving, turns to Holly.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You tired?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah, you look tired... Listen, honey. when all this is o going to sit down and buy you a big, thick steak.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I don't want a steak.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, we'll see about that... Hey, lookie. He nods at a wrecked car lying in a ditch beside the road

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: They're probably going to blame that on me, too, bastards

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF ANGLES
dialogues.text: Various shots characterizing the Midwest's reaction to Ki Holly a deserted street, law officers posing with their guns an ammunition, children walking from class under armed guard detective in a trench coat pointing at a pump, a woman ca her children at dusk, a county official posing with the c records, the court reporter with a book of signatures, vi signing up and being deputized, then riding through the s of their town in the backs of pickups, a priest among the HOLLY (v.o.) The whole country was out looking for us, for who knew wh would strike next? Sidewalks were deserted. Stores closed doors and drew their blinds. Posses and vigilante committ set up from Texas to North Dakota. Children rode back and to school under heavy guard. A famous detective was broug from Boston. He could find no clues ... My clarinet teach I probably wasn't responsible, but others said I was. The Thursday, the Governor of Oklahoma sent out the National stand watch at the Federal Reserve Bank in Tulsa when wor out that Kit meant to rob it... It was like the Russians invaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly approach a large Victorian mansion. Kit rin bell.  HOLLY (v.o.) We needed supplies, so we went to a rich man's house. Kit it'd be safer and quicker than shopping in the downtown.. came to the door. A MAID opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi, I come to check the meter. My tools are in here. He nods at the suitcase he is carrying. The Maid looks at

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Oh, this Is Holly. She's from Texas. Kit winks at Holly. The Maid brushes her ears to indicate she is deaf, then stands back to let them pass.  HOLLY (v.o.) Later we found out she was deaf and we hadn't even known

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Excuse me. They enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit leads the others into the living room. The owner of t house, a RICH MAN, sits in a chair in the corner, reviewi prints. At the sight of Kit he comes to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: This your place?

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Kit looks around, overwhelmed by the luxury of the mansio

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Sorry to barge in on you. Anybody else here besides you t

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: No. The Rich Man is wary. Kit nearly forgets to explain himse

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Good deal... Oh, uh, we're on the run and we'd like to ha here for a while. Couple of hours, maybe. How'd that be?

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Stay as long as you like.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON MURAL
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS across a mural of some pastoral scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly runs her finger around the lip of a crystal glass. a soft chiming noise. Kit, sitting at the end of a table her, picks up a dinner bell, rings it, then puts It down regards her solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Next time I ring that, it means time to clear out. Holly, in the next angle, has moved a bust off its pedest the corner of a piano. She thinks better of this and rest bust to its original position.  Kit sniffs at a glass of sherry, then takes a picture off mantel and studies it.  Holly, at the other end of the room. tests the comforts o chair. This done. she moves to another chair and tests it She makes her hand limp. She watches it swing back and fo Kit sits in the chair which the Rich Man occupied earlier a thoughtful look on his face. There is a dictaphone on t beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly takes a cane out of the umbrella rack, looks around furtively, then steps out a side door of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly walks down the slope of the lawn.  HOLLY (v.o.) I left Kit in the parlor and went for a stroll outside th The day was quiet and serene, but I didn't notice, for I in thought, and not even thinking about how to slip off. Across the way she can see a long driveway, with a border greenery and a sleepy cat standing in the sun.  HOLLY (v.o.) The world was like a faraway planet to which I could neve return... I thought what a fine place it was, full of thi people to look into and enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit talks into the dictaphone, recording some advice for people.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Listen to your parents and teachers. They got a line on m things, so don't treat them like enemies. There's always you could learn something. (he pauses for a moment) Try t an open mind. Try to understand the viewpoint of others. the minority opinion, but try to get along with the major opinion once it's accepted. (again he pauses) Course Holl I've had fun, even if it has been rushed, and... so far w doing fine. hadn't got caught. (annoyed) Excuse the gramm He sets down the dictaphone. puts out his cigarette and l back in his chair, lost in reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly enters the room where the Rich Man and his Maid hav put. The furniture and paintings are covered with sheets, suggesting that for some purpose, known only to the famil room has been set aside.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Hi... Kit's downstairs playing with the dictaphone... Som he acts like there's something wrong with his bean. She leans against the window. behind the couch where the is sitting.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Hope nothing ever goes wrong with mine.

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Think he's crazy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I don't know... He's kind of odd. She sits down beside the Rich Man.  HOLLY (shyly) They claim I've got him wrapped around my little finger, never told him to shoot anybody. She looks the room over.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Gosh, I like your house.

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. We hear the NOISE of a doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit puts down a copy of the Wall Street Journal and locat pistol. He starts for the door, then remembers that he mo picture from the mantel. He puts the picture back in plac checks the chamber of his pistol and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit opens the front door to find a VISITOR on the stoop. Visitor carries a roll of blueprints under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: Hi... ah, Mister Scarborough here?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah, but the thing about him, he's down with the flu. He

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'd invite you inside, except it's contagious. Don' to start an epidemic.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: No, of course not. It's only that he called last night an if I could come by.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, he didn't have it last night. The Visitor is puzzled by Kit's presence in the house, an more by his behavior. He takes out a note pad.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: Well, I'd like to leave a message, if that's okay.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Sure. The Visitor jots something down and hands the note to Kit

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You have to excuse me now. I have to go back inside. Bye. Kit closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit hides the Visitor's note in a vase and bounds up the to the first landing.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: We're out of here, Tex. He turns back down the stairs. On a rack at the bottom he hat and coat. He takes them with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit walks into the room where he left the Rich Man and hi He now carries a bag of groceries under his arm,

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi, whatcha doing?

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Just thinking.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Good a way to kill time as any... She okay? He points to the Maid with his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Listen, ah ... We're going to take the Cadillac for a whi How'd that be?

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I won't let her drive. He means Holly.  KIT (continuing) Oh, and here's a list of everything we borrowed. Car's on too. He gives the list to the Rich Man and signals the Maid to accompany them out.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Okay, ma'am, let's go . . . come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit points the Rich Man and his Maid into a closet.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You're my friend, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: RICH MAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Okay, no monkey business then. He locks the door of the closet once they are inside, sta then remembers something, takes a handkerchief out of his and wipes his fingerprints off the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Groceries. With this reminder he collects his bag of groceries and h down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly come out the front door. Holly wears a shaw her head as a disguise, Kit wears the outfit he took off Man's coat rack. He carries his groceries, rifle and a si trophy he stole from somewhere in the house.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: That guy could sell that list I gave him as a sample of m handwriting. Holly starts off,  KIT (continuing) Hey, why're you always walking ahead of me?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, why you always walking behind me? Kit grabs the seat of her pants.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Anybody ever done that to you before?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Positive?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Guess there's no way I'll ever know. For sure. They round a corner into the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down the lawn toward the garage. We the TICKING SPRINKLERS off camera.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: That guy must pay through the nose to keep this place up. the gas and electric... Bagworms. Plus the upkeep on the Yeah, you get a little money in your pocket, you think al problems are solved. Well, let me tell you, they're not. They arrive at the Cadillac. Holly sets down her suitcase waits for Kit to open the door for her.  Kit, who has forgotten this propriety, hurries back and o door. He throws the suitcase in the back, goes around the of the car and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I'd like to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Soon as I start the car... and fix my hat. He adjusts his hat, starts the car and they drive off, pa Rolls Royce Kit has declined in favor of the Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car races across the open prairie.  HOLLY (v.o.) Fearing there'd be roadblocks on the highways, we took of that area known as the Great Plains. Kit told me to enjoy scenery, and I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly reads to Kit from a movie fan magazine.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: "Rumor Pat Boone is seriously considering giving up his career s return to school full-time and complete his education. Fa Pat has told intimates that so long as things are going w his career, it's the education that will have to take the seat."

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I don't blame him.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: "Rumor Frank Sinatra and Rita Hayworth are in love... Fact True, but not with each other." Kit chuckles at this, which pleases Holly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac heads overland, along a line of telephone po stretches out clear to the horizon.  HOLLY (v.o.) Through desert and mesa, across the endless miles of open we made our headlong way, steering by the telephone lines the mountains of Montana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat waves rise off the land. A mountain is barely discer the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac races through a herd of cows,  HOLLY (v.o.) Kit'd sometimes ram a cow, to save on ammo, cook it.

dialogues.speaker: SALT GRASS
dialogues.text: Tight shot of a clump of salt grass.  HOLLY (v.o.) Once we had to eat a bunch of salt grass. It tasted like

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA RISES over the Cadillac as it races down a des country road at dawn,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac is stopped beside a pipeline waystation. Kit tapped some gas off the head.  HOLLY (v.o.) For gas we used the leakage from the valves of the pipeli found along the way. Drip gas is what they call it in tha of the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac roars through a stand of mesquite and disapp into the distance.  HOLLY (v.o.) Little by little we approached the border. Kit was glad t South Dakota behind and cursed its name. He said that if Communists ever dropped the atomic bomb, he wished they'd right in the middle of Rapid City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are camped out in the middle of the badlands. Kit co meat over a fire, Holly, with a map under her arm, points the distance.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: That's Montana over there.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I never been to Montana... Acquaintance of mine has, but hadn't... Never had any reason to. Holly sits down and looks at the map.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: State bird's a meadowlark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS across the badlands. There Is not a tree bush in sight. It comes to rest on Kit, who carries his r over his shoulders the way James Dean did in "Giant".

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF ANGLES
dialogues.text: Various sights of the prairie a distant mountain, a wild turkey, a lizard, a burst of  lightening in a cloud on the horizon, a falcon. Kit takes this in, then he turns back to the campsite. The sun is d just barely, and the moon has risen behind him. Holly is over this last shot.  HOLLY (v.o.) We lived in utter loneliness, neither here nor there. Kit that solitude was a better word, cause it meant more exac I wanted to say. Whatever the expression, I told him we c go on living this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly sit in the back seat of the Cadillac. They been necking. Her hair is in curlers.  KIT (responding to v.o.) Why not? I mean, I'm having fun... At least I'm not bitch

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Well, I feel kind of like an animal living out here. I me there's no place to bathe and... no place to get anything eat.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, I'll catch you a big trout. Soon as we get to the  mountains. He kisses her. She gives in reluctantly. After a while th break.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Everybody loves trout.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I'm serious. They neck some more. then break again. Kit looks out one Holly out the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train moves slowly across the horizon.  HOLLY (v.o.) In the distance I saw a train making its way silently acr plain, like the caravan in "The Adventures of Marco Polo. our first taste of civilization in days, and I asked Kit could have a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit sets a football down on the ground, backs off a few s squats and shoots a hole through it with his pistol. To h surprise. it does not deflate. He moves closer and pounds with the barrel of the pistol.  HOLLY (v.o.) Before we left he shot a football that he considered exce baggage.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON SUITCASE
dialogues.text: Kit is burying some things from Holly's suitcase in a buc the trophy he took from the mansion, her stereopticon sli doll, a spark plug, a pack of Camels, etc.  HOLLY (v.o.) Afterwards he took and buried some of our things in a buc said that nobody else would know where we'd put them, and we'd come back someday, maybe, and they'd still be sittin just the same, but we'd be different. And if we never got well, somebody might dig them up a thousand years from no wouldn't they wonder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac speeds across the plains. A plume of dust st out behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly have parked the Cadillac under a rail trest train is approaching. They hide beside the car. The train streamliner, roars overhead. When it has passed, Holly ru the grade to watch it disappear into the distance. Kit wa from the opposite end of the trestle.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Maybe we should've tried to hop it.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: It was going too fast.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I could've pulled the car up on the tracks, slowed it dow HOLLY (o.c.) Yeah, then we'd be stuck here.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, maybe we oughta be stuck here. I'm not saying that He stoops down and picks up a Pepsi bottle.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You're crazy. He climbs over the edge of the trestle, looks back at her then leaps down to the ground. Holly walks down to meet h HOLLY (v.o.) Kit took the bottle and spun it around, leaving to fate w direction we should take.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Kit spins the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottle comes to a stop. Kit inspects its position. He not appear satisfied, though.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, maybe the slope here is throwing it off some. We ou find a more flat place.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: How about over here? Kit starts toward her, then changes his mind and heads ba the grade, to the tracks. The CAMERA DOLLIES and CRANES w

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Never mind. It doesn't matter... If I'm worth a damn, I'l the right direction. And if I'm not, well, I don't care. I mean? HOLLY (o.c.) No.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, I shouldn't expect miracles, should I? He stops at the top of the grade and looks out across the Badlands.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: We'll keep on heading for that mountain... Just remember it wasn't such a hot idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac pulls out from under the trestle and heads d dusty road alongside the tracks.  HOLLY (v.o.) We took off at sunset, on a line toward the mountains of  Saskatchewan, for Kit a magical land beyond the reach of He needed me now more than ever, but something had come b us. I'd stopped even paying attention to him. Instead, I the car and read a map and spelled out entire sentences w tongue on the roof of my mouth, where nobody could read t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac beads off across the plains toward a distant mountain.  HOLLY (v.o.) That night we moved closer to the border, and clear acros prairie, at the very edge of the horizon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A refinery fire.  HOLLY (v.o.) W could make out the gas fires of the refinery at Missoul to the south...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLLY (v.o.) ... we could see the lights of Cheyenne, a city bigger an grander than I'd ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: PRAIRIE
dialogues.text: The prairie rushes under the Cadillac's headlights.  HOLLY (v.o.) I felt all kind of things looking at the lig Cheyenne, but most important, I made up my mind to never tag around with a hell-bent type, no matter how in love w I was. Finally, I found the strength to tell Kit this. I out that even If we got to the Far North, he still couldn a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit and Holly's faces are strangely lit by the dash light is absorbed in her map. The radio is on.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: (responding to v.o.) I could get a job with the Mounties. Northwest Mounties ... Hell, I got all the qualifications ride, shoot and... I don't mind the cold. Fact. I kind of the cold. Holly looks up from the map.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Nothing... I was just running off at the mouth... as usua

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I wasn't listening. Holly lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I was just talking about going after a job... Hey. don't He reaches over and takes the cigarette out of her mouth. CAMERA PANS to her with this gesture.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: You know... they'd probably ask to see your driver's lice before they hired you. KIT (o.c.) Well. I'm not going to let that stop me. When the CAMERA PANS BACK to him, he is looking at her ci

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You smoke Pall Mall?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah. He is surprised to discover this.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Nah, you hadn't seen me when I'm going after something, h Tough? He cocks his head just thinking about it. She reaches for radio to change the station. He pats her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey. don't touch that... Nat King Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dance in the headlights to the tune of "A Blossom Fe coming over the car radio. She is wearing the rich man's After a moment Kit whispers in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Boy, if I could sing a song like that... I mean, if I cou a song about the way I feel right now, it'd be a hit. They continue dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two shots of the Cadillac heading across the Badlands at HOLLY (v.o.) Kit knew the end was coming. He wondered if he'd hear the pronounce him dead, or if he'd be able to read what the p would say about him,the next day, from the other side. He the iea of being shot down alone, he said, without a girl scream out his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly yawns with fatigue.  HOLLY (v.o.) Then, for an instant, the sight of the mountains in the d light got his hopes back up. Kit shakes his head with admiration and wonder.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: God, what a sight... Tell me this, honey. What does a lit Texas girl like yourself think of a sight like that? She turns to look at the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mountains in the distance closer now than ever before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac drives up to an oil rig. Kit gets out of the

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Love this air. The ROUGHNECK in charge of the rig steps out of his trail seems there is nobody else around.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Morning... Say, you got any gas?

dialogues.speaker: ROUGHNECK
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well. I'm sorry. sir. but we've got to ask you for it. Holly walks over to inspect the rig.  KIT (o.c.) See, we're about out... been driving all night. Actually, even have time to explain it to you. ROUGHNECK (o.c.) Well, matter of fact, I don't have any.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Just a second now. That's your truck. isn't it? He points to a truck linked to the front of the trailer. looks idly around. Suddenly her expression changes, for w reason it is not clear.  KIT (o.c.) You didn't walk out here. ROUGHNECK (o.c.) It's mine all right.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, listen. I'm going to swap you my Cadillac. The Roughneck does not understand what Kit is up to.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Now don't worry. You're getting a fair deal. Hell. what's blue book value on this thing, Mildred? He slaps the hood of the Cadillac and looks to Holly. She still preoccupied with whatever it is she has seen, thoug ROUGHNECK (o.c.) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Name is Carruthers. Believe I shoot people every now and Not that I deserve a medal. Holly signals Kit with a nod at the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Kit! Kit looks up and sees a helicopter in the distance. He he a moment, then draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Okay, friend. start running. ROUGHNECK (o.c.) Just gimme a chance.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Git. Holly moves around the side of the rig and sits against a Kit joins her.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Boy. I had a feeling today was going to be the day... Hel

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: He's not coming to take us for a ride. either. Come on, l make a run for the car. He starts off in the direction of the car, but Holly call back.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I don't want to. Kit looks at her. surprised.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Have you got a better idea?

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: I just don't want to go.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What? She shrugs. He stares at her for a moment, then bows his walks off a distance.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you, huh? He kicks wildly at dust.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: What is the matter with you, huh!? Meanwhile, the helicopter continues its approach. Kit wal closer to Holly.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Boy, I don't know what to make of you. People like you. He kicks at the rigs then turns back to face her.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You want a second chance, then listen. Twelve noon the Gr Coulee Dam, New Year'ss Day. 1964. You meet me there... N got that? She nods, bewildered. The helicopter is landing. He grabs discarded fender off the truck, hangs it over his arm lik shield and runs to the Cadillac, exchanging shots with a Trooper who has arrived in the helicopter. The Trooper is falls. Kit jumps in the car and roars off. Holly surrende herself to the pilot of the helicopter and is taken off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit pulls into a gas station. He gets out of his car and the roof.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey, anybody here? An ATTENDANT walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi... Say,, you got any shells for a Savage, a .300 Savag

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Damn. I pissed all mine away shooting up bottles... You w fill her up for me? Please? The Attendant nods. Kit pulls Holly's suitcase out of the seat and walks over to a trash can at the edge of the apr throws Holly's things methodically into the trash can. Af while he comes upon a book. He opens the book and looks t it, then turns to find the Attendant staring at him. As h to his feet. he nods at the trash can.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: If you want any of that junk, it's yours. Meanwhile, a police car approaches the station. Kit sees about the same time the police see him. He throws his boo car and roars out of the station. The police car goes int bootlegger's turn and takes off after him.

dialogues.speaker: CHASE
dialogues.text: Kit heads down the highway. After a while he turns off on dirt road. The police keep up with him.. He flips on the and fires back at them. The dust is so heavy that they ha hard time just keeping track of him. He checks his own ap and general demeanor in the rear view mirror, then swerve the road onto the prairie. The police manage to keep up. they roar through a herd of cows and barb wire fence. The car slams into Kit, trying to slow him down. Kit slams ba the police car. They return to the road. Kit makes a nine degree turn but the police car loses traction and rolls o side, then back onto four wheels again, stalled. Kit sees has lost them. He checks himself out in the mirror again, the rich man's hat and skids to a stop. The police car ge underway. During these last few moments Holly is heard on

dialogues.speaker: OVER.
dialogues.text: HOLLY (v.o.) Often I've wondered what was going through Kit's head bef got him and why he didn't make a run for it while he stil the chance. Did he figure theyld just catch up with him t day? Was it despair? He claimed to having a flat tire, bu way he carried on about it, I suspect this is false.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit shoots a hole in the tire of the Cadillac, then climb the hood. We see how far behind the police are. He checks pulse and jumps back down. He scurries around collecting from the shoulder as the police approach from the distanc makes a stack of the rocks to mark the site of his captur posterity, finishing just as the police car skids to a st throws up his hands and walks forward to meet them. Their are drawn.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Hold it right there.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I could've held off an army if I could've gotten behind a the mountains. DEPUTY (o.c.) Oh yeah? KIT (nodding) Long as my ammo held out... Right there's where you caugh He nods at the stack of rocks. The Sheriff frisks him as Deputy covers.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: We did it, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You better not leave that Cadillac sitting out here. The Sheriff takes out a pair of handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Put your hands in back of your head. The Sheriff claps the handcuffs on one of Kit's wrists.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Now put the other one on yourself. Kit does as the Sheriff asks. The Deputy holsters his pis walks forward to inspect their prize. He and KIT exchange glances.
