DEPUTY (to Sheriff) Hell, he ain't no bigger than I am. The Sheriff sticks his pistol in Kit's ear and leads him toward the police car.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You're going to give me a cauliflower ear, Sheriff. The Sheriff gives Kit a shove.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: He should've thought about that before he got caught... S he? The Deputy draws his pistol and fires a shot into the nei field. Kit is startled. The Deputy makes the same motion, time without firing.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Hup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car sails down an open stretch of highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit thinks for a while, then turns to the Sheriff, who is driving.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Think I'll take the juice?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Beats me. The Deputy, fascinated, watches all this from the back se turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Say, what kind of rifle was that you were shooting at me?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Thirty aught six. KIT (o.c.) You ever had to open it up like that before?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Nope. Kit turns back around.  KIT (reassuringly) Well, you boys have performed like a couple of heroes... don't think I'm not going to pass it around when we get t The Sheriff lifts the hat off Kit's head and tosses it ou window. It rolls to a stop on the highway behind them.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You tossed my hat out the window. SHERIFF (o.c.) Wanta sue me?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Kit... Kit, I've got a question for you.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Mmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: You like people?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: They're okay.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Then why'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I don't know. Always wanted to be a criminal, I guess. Ju this big a one... Takes all kinds though. Kit gets a smile from the Deputy. The Deputy turns to the Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: You know who that sombitch looks like? (no reply) You kno you? Kit is anxious to hear the answer.  SHERIFF (o.c.) No.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: I'll kiss your ass if he don't look like James Dean. Kit drops his eyes and turns away, deeply gratified by th remark. The Sheriff smiles at the Deputy in the rear mirr car roars past a freight train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit stands on the wing of a light plane, inside a large h the local airport. He is shackled in a leather transfer v takes souvenirs out of his pockets and tosses them out to of Montana State Troopers and National Guardsmen milling on the tarmac ground below him.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: How you doing there, Kit? KIT (o.c.) Fine as can be expected. Just locked up, can't move. MECHANIC (o.c.) That's a nice little coat you got on there.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You think?... it's leather. He takes out his cigarette lighter.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey, now here's a real prize. I must've had this about te Who's going to get it? VOICE (o.c.) Gimme that sombitch.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: There you go. SECOND VOICE (o.c.) Where you from?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: South Dakota. Where you from? SECOND VOICE (o.c.) Here.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Want a comb? He takes a comb out of his pocket and pitches it down to  somebody. He ignores most of the questions coming at him. THIRD VOICE (o.c.) Joni James is from South Dakota.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Yeah, she got out of there, too. FOURTH VOICE (o.c.) You ever been to Kansas? FIFTH VOICE (o.c.) Hey, Kit. whot's your favorite singer?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Eddie Fisher. Who's yours? FIFTH VOICE (o.c.) Eddie Fisher.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Damn! Want a pen? He pitches the man a ballpoint. The CAMERA MOVES BACK to SHOT of the whole scene.  SIXTH VOICE (o.c.) How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Don't you read the papers? SIXTH VOICE (.o.c.) You ever been married?

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: No sir, I hadn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various SHOTS of the National Guardsmen dozing on the pav playing cards beside the hangar, a little bored. Also a s Holly with the Sheriff and Deputy.  SEVENTH VOICE (o.c.) Hey, Kit, you afraid of death? KIT (o.c.) I hadn't thought about it much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deputy walks up to Kit with some legal papers.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, Tom, I don't mean to tell you how to run you here but these cuffs are pinching. What do you say now?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: I need to get your signature on some papers here, Kit.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Well, I've got to read them first. Suppose I could get a while I do?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Come on. He gives Kit the papers and leads him out of the hangar. turns back to the crowd inside.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You boys keep out of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Don't worry about us.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Holly's over here, Kit. if you want to see her.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly leans against the fender of the police car. She wea handcuffs. Kit turns to a State Trooper who holds him by tether.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: You want to give me a little slack here? The Trooper pays out the slack. Kit leans against the car Holly exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Don't worry now.. I'm going to get you off these charges. There's a whole lot of other boys out there. You're going a lot of fun. Holly looks down.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Boy, we rang the bells, didn't we? Holly does not reply.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I'll say one thing, though... That guy with the deaf maid just lucky he's not dead, too. Holly does not appreciate the humor of this. Kit, chasten turns serious.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Course it's too bad about your dad.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: We're going to have to sit down, and talk about that some He looks up at the SOUND of an incoming plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane that will take them back to South Dakota, a B-2 in for a landing. The mass of Troopers and National Guard with Kit and Holly, walks out to meet it. A jeep leads it the taxiway. A civilian bystander points Kit and Holly ou young boy he holds in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit signs his extradition papers on the back of the Chief Trooper, gives them to the Deputy and shakes hands with t Chief.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, Chief Sims. Sorry if I caused you an inconvenience.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: You didn't cause me any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Thanks anyway. He turns to shake hands with the Deputy. The planets engi to life.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Well, Kit...

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Tom...

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Good luck to you.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: I know you do. Good luck to you, too.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: Now we go. The Trooper pulls him toward the plane. Kit calls Holly.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Come on, Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The props start turning. The crowd waves goodbye as the b door is closed. The wheels turn toward the sun. The Guard race back to their trucks. A mailman carries off the mail collected from the plane. The plane taxies down the runwa lifts into the air.  HOLLY (v.o.) Kit and I were taken back to South Dakota. They kept him solitary, so he didn't have a chance to get acquainted wi other inmates, though he was sure they'd like him, especi murderers. Myself, I got off with probation and a lot of looks. Later I married the son of the lawyer who defended (pause) Kit went to sleep in the courtroom while his conf was being read, and he was sentenced to die in the electr chair. On a warm spring night, six months later, after do his body to science, he did.  With Holly's last words we CUT INSIDE the cabin of the pl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kit sits next to the Trooper at the back of the plane. Ho opposite them, with a Detective behind her. Kit's attenti fixed on the military hat in the Trooper's lap.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Sir... Where'd you get that hat?

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: State.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Boy, I'd like to buy me one of those. The Trooper smiles. Holly looks up.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER
dialogues.text: You're quite an individual, Kit.

dialogues.speaker: KIT
dialogues.text: Think they'll take that into consideration? The Trooper smiles and looks out the window. Kit looks to to see if she has taken this remark in the proper spirit. smiles and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: An unbroken sea of clouds stretches out before her.
